title.narrative: Innovation in Analytics, Technology and Partnerships to Eliminate Slavery in Thai Supply Chains

description.narrative: The Issara Institute will work to decrease the incidence of trafficking by promoting cleaner supply chains and safer work places. This will be accomplished by increasing private-sector partnerships and through awareness raising efforts. Specifically, the Issara Institute will expand its anti-trafficking hotline and continue the development of a Burmese-language smartphone app for migrant laborers in Thailand. In collaboration with private sector companies, Issara Institute will use the data from their hotline and app to improve supply chain tractability and risk identification for private sector companies.

title.narrative: Prevention, Protection, and Restoration for victims and girls at risk of Trafficking In Persons, Forced Labor, and Sexual Abuse

description.narrative: The New Life Center Foundation (NLCF) will prevent TIP by providing education and training to tribal persons most vulnerable throughout Thailand. Additionally, the NLCF will provide protection and restoration for tribal victims of TIP, forced labor, and sexual abuse. Prevention activities include education, life skills, and vocational training for girls most vulnerable to TIP within Thailand. Protection and restoration for victims includes the provision of safe shelter, medical and mental health services, interpretation assistance, formal and informal education, vocational training, therapeutic activities (e.g. art, baking, handicrafts and music) and return and reintegration assistance.

title.narrative: Providing Assistance and Support to Victims of Human Trafficking in Thailand's Fishing Industry

description.narrative: The Labor Rights Promotion Network (LPN) will provide direct assistance and support to victims in the fisheries industry including shelter services, legal aid and witness protection assistance; improve protection strategies, provide training to community leaders, villagers, and fishermen; and coordinate law enforcement on investigations/prosecutions. LPN will raise awareness of the Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) and Good Labour Practice (GLP) guides in the fishing industry, and on human trafficking in Thailand's fishing industry through media and technology.

title.narrative: Prevention, Protection, and Restoration for victims and girls at risk of Trafficking In Persons, Forced Labor, and Sexual Abuse

description.narrative: The New Life Center Foundation (NLCF) will prevent TIP by providing education and training to tribal persons most vulnerable throughout Thailand. Additionally, the NLCF will provide protection and restoration for tribal victims of TIP, forced labor, and sexual abuse. Prevention activities include education, life skills, and vocational training for girls most vulnerable to TIP within Thailand. Protection and restoration for victims includes the provision of safe shelter, medical and mental health services, interpretation assistance, formal and informal education, vocational training, therapeutic activities (e.g. art, baking, handicrafts and music) and return and reintegration assistance.

title.narrative: Documentation and Assessment of the 17th-Century Wat Chaiwatthanaram at Ayutthaya

description.narrative: To support the documentation and assessment of the 17th-century Wat Chaiwatthanaram as a pilot for addressing flood damage at this and other structures at the World Heritage site of Ayutthaya. A major tourist attraction of Ayutthaya, this former Buddhist wat was already deteriorating when severe flooding in 2011 damaged brickwork, stucco, woodwork and mural paintings. The project involves intensive surveys of the site, including laser scanning and digital mapping, and field tests of conservation techniques.

title.narrative: Conservation of 19th-Century Objects in the Royal Collection of the Maharajanusorn King Rama IV Museum in Bangkok

description.narrative: The Maharajanusorn King Rama IV Museum houses objects once owned by King Rama IV, one of Thailands most beloved monarchs. This project, which involves the conservation of manuscripts, silks, and other objects from Rama IVs reign, directly supports the U.S. embassys efforts to strengthen ties with Thai institutions on the occasion of the 200th anniversary of the first Thai-U.S. contact in 1818.

title.narrative: Reducing Trafficking in Persons (TIP) to Northern Thailand

description.narrative: Under this project, TRAFCORD will bring together a local network of government and non-government agencies to address the migration and humanitarian crisis in Thailands northern borders with Burma and Laos, both Tier 3 countries. TRAFCORD will work to prevent trafficking among individuals migrating to Thailand in search of greater opportunity, with special attention to marginalized populations (e.g., stateless individuals, refugees, and ethnic minorities), especially women and children. This will be accomplished through cross-border interventions, including awareness campaigns targeting migrant workers throughout the migration cycle, and by strengthening the capacity of Thai multidisciplinary teams to work with their cross-border counterparts in Burma and Laos to identify and protect victims. Community centers will be set up in high risk areas and workshops will be held with school-age children, youth leaders, migrant workers, and other high-risk groups to raise awareness of the dangers of exploitation and trafficking.

description.narrative: The 17th-century Wat Chaiwatthanaram at Ayutthaya was the medieval capital of Siam and endures today as one of Thailands most important World Heritage sites. This project, which continues work begun under previous Ambassadors Fund grants, is part of a multi-phased effort within Thailand to assess and repair the damage and address on a larger scale the seasonal flooding issues associated with Thailands yearly monsoons.

title.narrative: ZOE Enhanced Victim Protection Services - Thailand

description.narrative: ZOE is enhancing victim protection in Thailand by improving the quality and range of existing comprehensive services for child trafficking victims and children at risk of being trafficked, with a special focus on migrant populations and tribal communities. This project is (1) expanding service capacity by increasing investment in professional staff and resources with the goal of increasing the capabilities of ZOE service providers and partners; (2) upgrading security measures in shelters; (3) equipping victims with marketable educational and vocational skills in order to reduce their vulnerability to trafficking and re-trafficking; and (4) increasing the capacity of law enforcement, prosecutors, and service providers in Northern Thailand to identify victims and provide enhanced victim protection services.

title.narrative: Preservation of the 17th-Century Wat Chaiwathanaram at Ayutthaya

description.narrative: Severe flooding in 2011 damaged the brickwork, stucco, woodwork and mural paintings of the wat, one of the central landmarks of Ayutthaya, the former capital of the Kingdom of Siam. This project, which continues work begun in 2012, involves intensive surveys of the site, including laser scanning and digital mapping, and field tests of conservation techniques.
